4.1. Datasets¶

4.1.1. Dataset module¶

Base class for DataSets

Add a column to the dataset :param column_name: Name of the column to be added :type column_name: str :param column_data: ndarray of the column data to be added :type column_data: np.ndarray :param column_major_name: The name of the column major to be added to the gathered_column_names list, if not None :type column_major_name: str

Returns

None

column_names = []¶
create_scatter_plot(x_column, y_column, scale='lin', autoscale=True)[source]¶

Creates and plots a scatter plot of data in the dataset. :param x_column: Column name of the x_data :type x_column: str :param y_column: Column name of the y_data :type y_column: str :param scale: The desired scale of the y_axis (either ‘log’ or ‘lin’) :type scale: str :param autoscale: Flag for autoscaling the data :type autoscale: bool

Returns

None. Just plots the plot

get_column(column_name, master_independent_value_range=None)[source]¶

Get the column of the column_name :param column_name: The name of the desired column. Should be in the self.column_names list :type column_name: str :param master_independent_value_range: Range of min and max values of the master independent to be indexed. For each master

independent column, values between the value closest to min and max will be indexed. If min is 2.1 and the master independent is 1.0, 2.0, 3.0, the values greater than 2.0 will be indexed

Returns

np.ndarray column data

master_dependent = None¶
master_independent = None¶

Returns

None

class SemiPy.Datasets.Dataset.SetDataSet(secondary_independent_values=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: SemiPy.Datasets.Dataset.BaseDataSet

add_column(column_name, column_data, secondary_indep_value=None)[source]¶

Similar to DatSet.add_column but enforces that there must enough columns for every subset ofvd_values=None, the dataset :param column_name: :type column_name: str :param column_data: The committing data. Should be of shape (number of subsets, number of rows) :type column_data: np.ndarray :param secondary_indep_value: The value of the secondary independent. If None, then just add as normal :type secondary_indep_value: float

Returns

None

add_column_set(column_name, column_data, secondary_value)[source]¶

Similar to add_column, but allows adding a column specifically to a set indexed by the secondary value a column to the dataset :param column_name: Name of the column to be added :type column_name: str :param column_data: ndarray of the column data to be added :type column_data: np.ndarray :param secondary_value: The value of the secondary_independent to be indexed :type secondary_value: int or float

Returns

None

adjust_column(column_name, func)[source]¶

Similar to adjust_column for DataSet but deals with 2D arrays :param column_name: :param func:

Returns

None

Parameters

  • return_set_values (bool) – If True, return the columns and corresponding set values

get_column_set(column_name, secondary_value)[source]¶

Similar to get_column but allows index by the secondary_value to return a single column :param column_name: The name of the column wanted. Should be in self.column_names :type column_name: str :param secondary_value: The value of the secondary_independent to be indexed :type secondary_value: int, float

Returns

np.ndarray of the column
